intro: Katherinea citrinocastanea, commonly known as the golden castanea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its fruit is a capsule containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
